pullRequest.body:
Adds `#allow_unused_tactic!`, the persistent version of `#allow_unused_tactic`.

For instance, writing
```lean
#allow_unused_tactic!
  Lean.Parser.Tactic.done
  Lean.Parser.Tactic.skip
```

makes the tactics `done` and `skip` invisible to the unused tactic linter from where the command is issued onwards, also in files that transitively import the file where the command appears.

The PR also includes a utility function `#show_kind tac` to help find the `SyntaxNodeKind` of the tactic `tac`.  For instance, using
```lean
#show_kind exact _
```
reports that the `SyntaxNodeKind` is `'Lean.Parser.Tactic.exact'.`.

[Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Persistent.20.23allow_unused_tactic)

---

The `large-import` tag is due to adding an environment extension, which requires a separate file and hence one more import in a file that imports very little.

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

### PR summary [f7d241dc24](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20438/commits/f7d241dc2431be9e05d4e303ab4f9601d5455dc9)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +5.56% | `Mathlib.Init` |
| +20.00% | `Mathlib.Tactic.Linter.UnusedTactic` |

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 5695 files with changed transitive imports taking up over 236557 characters: this is too many to display!
You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ addAllowedUnusedTactic`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

The triage party's suggests that we hit merge and let you discover whether or not it's behaving as expected :-) 

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13240025047/job/36953114898)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13240025047/job/36953114584)

Some of these exceptions could be removed from here and introduced where the corresponding tactics are defined.

It is not completely clear to me whether the advantage of having a check for the name of the tactic outweights the non-discoverability of which tactics are ignored...

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: persistent `#allow_unused_tactic`
